      • commit

        public void commit()
        Perform a 2-phase commit by first calling prepareCommit() on the TextIndex followed by committing the Transaction object, and then calling commit() on the TextIndex().

        If either of the objects fail on either the preparation or actual commit, it terminates and calls abort() on both of them.

        NOTE: it may happen that the TextIndex fails to commit, after the Transactional has already successfully committed. A rollback instruction will still be issued, but depending on the implementation, it may not have any effect.

        Specified by:
        commit in interface Transactional
        Overrides:
        commit in class DatasetGraphWrapper

      • supportsTransactionAbort

        public boolean supportsTransactionAbort()
